title: inconsistent behavior of max
body_html:
max function behaves strangely when the first dimension equals to 1.

import torch
print(torch.__version__)
# 0.2.0_1

T = torch.rand(3, 7)
value, index = T.max(0)
print(index.size())
# [7]

T = torch.rand(1, 7)
value, index = T.max(0)
print(index.size())
# [1, 7]
body_text:
max function behaves strangely when the first dimension equals to 1.
import torch
print(torch.__version__)
# 0.2.0_1

T = torch.rand(3, 7)
value, index = T.max(0)
print(index.size())
# [7]

T = torch.rand(1, 7)
value, index = T.max(0)
print(index.size())
# [1, 7]
body:
`max` function behaves strangely when the first dimension equals to 1.

```
import torch
print(torch.__version__)
# 0.2.0_1

T = torch.rand(3, 7)
value, index = T.max(0)
print(index.size())
# [7]

T = torch.rand(1, 7)
value, index = T.max(0)
print(index.size())
# [1, 7]
```
